marketNews.title: Toyota: Masih Terlaris di Dunia, namun Muncul Skandal Baru
marketNews.content:
Toyota Motor Corp. (TYO: 7203) on Monday (29/1) announced that it will temporarily halt shipments of 10 car models due to diesel engine certification issues. The problem was discovered after an investigation committee found that the affected models have differences in horsepower output and Engine Control Unit (ECU) compared to the certification test. According to Toyota Motor Corp., one of the affected models is the Toyota Fortuner produced by PT Toyota Motor Manufacturing Indonesia (TMMIN). 

TMMIN Vice President Director Bob Azam claimed that the case is not related to vehicles in Indonesia, stating the issue concerns certification procedures in several countries other than Indonesia and does not affect vehicle safety or emissions. 

The diesel engine certification issue comes a month after a scandal at its subsidiary Daihatsu Motor Co., which was found to have manipulated safety tests on 64 car models. Consequently, Daihatsu will halt shipments and suspend operations at least until February 2024. 

Meanwhile, Toyota Motor Corp. announced that global vehicle sales reached 11.2 million units in 2023, up 7.2% YoY, making Toyota the world’s best-selling car maker for the fourth consecutive year. Total Toyota and Lexus sales were 10.3 million units in 2023. Of that, hybrid electric vehicle (HEV) sales rose 31.4% YoY to 3.4 million units, while battery electric vehicle (BEV) sales were only 104 thousand units. 

For comparison, Toyota’s BEV competitors BYD and Tesla recorded 1.57 million units (+72.8% YoY) and 1.81 million units (+38% YoY) respectively in 2023.

marketNews.title: HRUM Beli 60,7% Westrong Metal Industry US$215,22 Juta
marketNews.content:
HRUM Beli 60,7% Westrong Metal Industry US$215,22 Juta

- $HRUM: Harum Energy, through its subsidiary PT Harum Nickel Industry, acquired 1.21 million (60.7%) shares of PT Westrong Metal Industry (WMI) for approximately US$215.22 million. After the transaction, HRUM’s ownership in WMI rises from 20% to 80.7%. WMI operates a smelter with a production capacity of 56,000 tonnes of nickel matte per year at Weda Bay Industrial Park, expected to start commercial operation in 2Q24.
- $BSDE: Bumi Serpong Damai recorded marketing sales of +8% YoY to IDR 9.5 trillion in 2023, surpassing the target (108%) of IDR 8.8 trillion. Residential segment contributed 53% of the total, followed by land sales to joint ventures (20%), shophouses (15%), commercial (8%) and apartments (5%). Quarterly, 4Q23 marketing sales grew +40% QoQ to IDR 2.75 trillion.
- $INCO: Vale Indonesia reported 4Q23 nickel matte production of 19,084 tonnes (+6.3% QoQ, +17.9% YoY). In 2023, nickel matte production grew +17.7% YoY to 70,728 tonnes, exceeding the target of 70,000 tonnes.
- $DSNG: Dharma Satya Nusantara reported 2023 fresh fruit bunch (TBS) production of 2.27 million tonnes (+2.6% YoY) and CPO of 661,892 tonnes (+3.5% YoY). Quarterly, 4Q23 TBS and CPO were 623,387 tonnes (+6.4% QoQ) and 187,969 tonnes (+10.8% QoQ). 2023 CPO sales rose +4% YoY to 665,041 tonnes, with average price up +1.9% YoY to IDR 11.39 million per tonne.
- $AMOR: Ashmore Asset Management Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend of IDR 18.5 per share. The dividend is payable on 23 February 2024, with cum-dividend on the regular market on 7 February 2024. Based on AMOR’s closing price of IDR 1,025 per share on Tuesday (30/1), the implied dividend yield is 1.8%.
- The Indonesian government’s 2024 social-protection budget reaches IDR 496.8 trillion, up +12.02% YoY from 2023 and may become a record high. Economist Center of Reform on Economic, Yusuf Rendy Manilet said the accelerated disbursement early in the year should boost budget absorption, though he warned of misuse in an election year.
- Finance Minister Sri Mulyani projected Indonesia’s 2023 economic growth at around +5% (target +5.3%). BPS will release the official 2023 growth data on 5 February 2024. For 2024, the government targets +5.2% growth.
- Finance Minister Sri Mulyani said the rupiah will stay stable with an upside bias, supported by a weaker US dollar amid expectations of a Fed rate cut. On Tuesday (30/1) the rupiah strengthened +0.27% to IDR 15,784 per US$, after slipping to a 2.5-month low of IDR 15,845 on Friday (26/1) amid media reports of a possible resignation.
- Deputy III of the Presidential Staff Office, Edy Priyono, said the government is considering raising the maximum retail price (HET) of rice, as the current HET no longer reflects rice prices with a 30.26% disparity.
- BEI Director of Development Jeffrey Hendrik said the exchange will consider changing the LQ45 index rebalancing frequency from semi-annual to quarterly, with a possible start in March 2024.
- BEI announced the IDX High Dividend 20 index review effective 5 February 2024 – 4 February 2025. Additions: $BRPT, $ICBP, $INKP, $KLBF, $SMGR, $TPIA, $UNVR. Removals: $BJBR, $BJTM, $BNGA, $BSSR, $HEXA, $HMSP, $MPMX.

tickerNews.title: Toyota diesel-engine certification issue and impact on ASII
tickerNews.content: Toyota Motor Corp. announced a temporary halt of shipments for 10 car models because of diesel-engine certification issues. The issue was found after an investigation committee detected differences in horsepower output and ECU compared with the certification test. The problem does not affect vehicles sold in Indonesia, according to TMMIN Vice President Director Bob Azam, who said the case concerns certification procedures in other countries and does not affect vehicle safety or emissions.

tickerNews.title: Harum Energy acquires 60.7% of Westrong Metal Industry
tickerNews.content: Harum Energy, through its subsidiary PT Harum Nickel Industry, acquired 1.21 million (60.7%) shares of PT Westrong Metal Industry for approximately US$215.22 million, raising its stake from 20% to 80.7%. WMI operates a smelter with 56,000 tonnes per year nickel-matte capacity at Weda Bay Industrial Park, expected to start commercial operation in 2Q 2024.

tickerNews.title: Bumi Serpong Damai records 2023 marketing sales growth
tickerNews.content: Bumi Serpong Damai reported marketing sales of IDR 9.5 trillion in 2023, up 8% YoY and surpassing its target of IDR 8.8 trillion. The residential segment contributed 53% of the total, followed by land sales to joint ventures (20%), shophouses (15%), commercial (8%) and apartments (5%). Quarterly, 4Q23 marketing sales rose 40% QoQ to IDR 2.75 trillion.

tickerNews.title: Vale Indonesia 4Q23 nickel-matte production results
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia reported 4Q23 nickel-matte production of 19,084 tonnes, a rise of 6.3% QoQ and 17.9% YoY. Full-year 2023 production reached 70,728 tonnes, beating the 70,000-tonne target.

tickerNews.title: Dharma Satyag N-       …
tickerNews.content: Dharma Satyag Nusantara reported 2023 TBS (2.27 million tonnes) and CPO 661 892 tonnes, up 2.6% and 3.5% YoY respectively. Quarterly 4Q23 TBS 623 387 tonnes (+6.4% QoY) and CPO 187 969 tonnes (+10.8% QoY). 2023 CPO sales grew 4% YoY to 665 041 tonnes, with an average price of IDR 11.39 million per tonne.
